conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.

There are multiple slanted baffles in the image: green, orange, cyan, white, purple, and yellow, which guide the flow of liquid.
The green baffle is positioned to deflect streams from A and B towards the center and left, while the stream from C is deflected to the right.
The cyan baffle is slanted downward and splits the combined flow from A and B at the bottom, directing part of it into container D and part into container E.
The stream from C continues along its own baffle and falls into container E.
